title: Poldark's Eleanor Tomlinson lands new role in sci-fi epic Intergalatic
text:
Eleanor Tomlinson is set to star in a new sci-fi epic (Picture: Mammoth Screen)

Poldark star Eleanor Tomlinson is set to lead the cast of a new sci-fi epic called Intergalactic, following the end of the popular BBC drama this year.

The new series – produced by Sky – sees a gang of female prisoners hijack a spaceship and set off into the galaxy in search for freedom.

Tomlinson will portray Candy, who is described as ‘a good-time girl with a double tongue and a witty one-liner for any given situation’.

The actress will portray a sharp-tongued female prisoner (Picture: PA)

Which basically sounds as far away from Demelza as you could possibly get.

The actress will be joined in the serial by Savannah Steyn, Parminder Nagra and Natasha O’Keefe.

The space opera will paint a pretty dystopian picture, where life on Earth has dramatically changed and the populous is ruled over by a global authority known as the Commonworld.

Poldark came to an end this year after five series (Picture: Mammoth Screen)

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I’m very excited to be jumping years into the future to take on the role of Candy, the drug mule from the planet Skov,’ Tomlinson said.

‘Now that’s not something you hear every day!’ She added. ‘There’s not a corset in sight!’

Cameron Roach Sky’s Director of Drama & Sky Studios said: ‘We are delighted to begin our Intergalactic journey with such an incredibly talented cast.

‘We cannot wait to see them in action, in the most unique and phenomenal spaceship. With the backdrop of the galaxy, it really does promise to be a high octane prison drama like no other.’

Intergalactic will be coming to Sky soon.

description: Poldark's Eleanor Tomlinson has landed a new role in a sci-fi epic called Intergalactic following the end of her tenure in Poldark this year.
